text:
DatagramStringAppender, JDBCAppender, TempFileAppender, and DailyFileAppender 
still advertise getOptionStrings() and setOptions(String, String) as methods 
signatures. 

The 1.1.3 release of Log4j deprecated these methods and the 1.2 release 
appears to be attempting to remove them all together. If retained in the 
classes above(for some reason?), then the message "super.getOptionStrings()" 
and "super.setOptions(String, String)" within need to be modified as they 
reference methods that are no longer available in 1.2rc1.
creator: sdoherty@kc.rr.com
ceki@apache.org
text:
Scottm

Thanks for the heads up. DatagramStringAppender, TempFileAppender, and 
DailyFileAppender  are not part of the log4j distribution. The JDBCAppender 
writtten by Kevin Steppe does not suffer from this problem. Can you please 
forward your remarks to the log4j-user list? I can't directly help you with 
these Appenders.
